title: paper-analyses
text: want analyze variations amount time spent brushing dental region, session--session among participants. particular, want know whether participants spent time brushing lower teeth upper teeth, left versus right, inner (lingual) versus outer (buccal) surfaces.

what: Model for brushing duration per region
title: paper-analyses
text: fit zero-inflated negative binomial regression model amount time (measured counts 25 Hz samples) spent brushing region, log-link count submodel logistic link zero-inflation submodel. submodels fixed effects tooth surface, mouth side, jaw, random effects intercept session nested participant, account person--person session--session variability overall brushing duration. count submodel also included participant-specific random effects tooth surface, mouth side, jaw. attempted add participant-specific random effects tooth surface, mouth side, jaw zero-inflation submodel, estimation algorithm failed converge extended model. AIC model 18,598.76, 69,183.57 less zero-inflated Poisson model fixed random effects. BIC model 18,865.64, 69,116.85 less zero-inflated Poisson model fixed random effects.

previous_headings: Model for brushing duration per region

paper-analyses
text: , fit zero-inflated negative binomial model; zero-inflation count submodels include fixed effects tooth surface, side, jaw, random effects intercept participant session. extended model participant-level random effects tooth surface, side, jaw failed converge. title: paper-analyses
text: fit negative binomial regression model total duration brushing session (measured counts 25 Hz samples), log-link, random intercepts participant, person-specific dispersion parameters (modeled fixed effects due limitations modeling package).
